body_html:
The line with the error is:

C:\Users\Irene\Documents\tensorflow\tensorflow\contrib\cmake\build\eigen\src\eigen-build\CMakeFiles\CMakeTmp\CheckIncludeFile.c(1): fatal error C1083: Cannot open include file: 'pthread.h': No such file or directory [C:\Users\Irene\Documents\tensorflow\tensorflow\contrib\cmake\build\eigen\src\eigen-build\CMakeFiles\CMakeTmp\cmTC_55681.vcxproj]

So I guess the question is why is eigen trying to include pthread.h on Windows?

I was able to reproduce this on my box, when previously (Nov 2016, commit 2531ebc) it worked fine. However even that previously good commit no longer functions now. This suggests Eigen upstream has changed something to break the tensorflow cmake build.

body:
The line with the error is:

`C:\Users\Irene\Documents\tensorflow\tensorflow\contrib\cmake\build\eigen\src\eigen-build\CMakeFiles\CMakeTmp\CheckIncludeFile.c(1): fatal error C1083: Cannot open include file: 'pthread.h': No such file or directory [C:\Users\Irene\Documents\tensorflow\tensorflow\contrib\cmake\build\eigen\src\eigen-build\CMakeFiles\CMakeTmp\cmTC_55681.vcxproj]`

So I guess the question is why is eigen trying to include `pthread.h` on Windows?

I was able to reproduce this on my box, when previously (Nov 2016, commit 2531ebc0fe7fc96) it worked fine. However even that previously good commit no longer functions now. This suggests Eigen upstream has changed something to break the tensorflow cmake build.
